intro: Ledermanniella yiben, commonly known as the Yiben lichen, is a unique species of lichen belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its intricate thallus structure, which is typically crustose and tightly adherent to its substrate. The plant exhibits a pale to dark yellowish-green coloration, with a finely granular surface texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on bark or rock surfaces in temperate regions. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
